page.title: 10THE CATTERY SANDON
page.content: There are two buildings for the cats to stay in and we saw fifteen cats there. Each cat has it's own compartment with a litter tray on the floor. There is a plank of wood for the cat to climb, to reach a higher shelf. There the cat can eat or just sit and sleep. The cats are cleaned and fed at 7.30 a.m. and fed and cleaned again at 4.30 p.m. During the winter the cats often stay for a few weeks, but in summer, it is usually only for a week or two. To own a cattery you need planning permission from the council. Every year a vet comes round to check the animals, so that the owner can apply for a licence. As well as the cattery there is a smallholding. The owners have four dogs, five cats, two horses, two cockerels, five goslings, some geese, chickens, ducks and goats.
